description: The Formula 1 news-sphere was ignited by the announcement last week that Sebastian Vettel would leave Ferrari at the end of 2020, after the four-time champion failed to meet eye-to-eye in contract negotiations with the Scuderia. And speaking on the latest episode of F1 Nation, Formula 1 racer-turned-pundit David Coulthard teed up an intriguing possibility for Vettel’s next move…
body: The Formula 1 news-sphere was ignited by the announcement last week that Sebastian Vettel would leave Ferrari at the end of 2020, after the four-time champion failed to meet eye-to-eye in contract negotiations with the Scuderia. And speaking on the latest episode of F1 Nation, Formula 1 racer-turned-pundit David Coulthard teed up an intriguing possibility for Vettel’s next move…
title: ‘He could be a brilliant asset’ – Coulthard’s intriguing theory on a possible leftfield move for Vettel

description: The government of the United Kingdom has implemented a 14-day quarantine period for all international arrivals, including citizens returning home from abroad - but Silverstone officials remain confident that the Formula 1 British Grand Prix can still take place.
author: Sam Hall
title: Optimism remains over the British Grand Prix despite new UK quarantine laws
body: The government of the United Kingdom has implemented a 14-day quarantine period for all international arrivals, including citizens returning home from abroad - but Silverstone officials remain confident that the Formula 1 British Grand Prix can still take place.

description: Daniel Ricciardo and McLaren will be a successful combination former Formula 1 champion Mika Hakkinen has predicted.
author: Ewan Gale
title: McLaren move a second chance for Ricciardo F1 success
body: Daniel Ricciardo and McLaren will be a successful combination former Formula 1 champion Mika Hakkinen has predicted.

description: The FIA president discusses F1's plans to start in Austria under strict safety conditions, the latest on talks to reduce the sport's new budget cap, and why anyone who takes on Sebastian Vettel will be 'very lucky'
author: Craig Slater
title: Jean Todt exclusive: FIA president on how motorsport plans to restart
body: Formula 1's governing body has learned from the season's aborted opening event, so that Austria, unlike Australia, would go ahead even amid positive COVID-19 tests.

author: Richard Lee
title: Welcome to the University of Auckland Motorsport Club!
body: The best club on campus! The University of Auckland Motorsport App is the your one stop for all you motorsport news and club events. We are just ordinary students like you and we would like to bring some entertainment to you when all the busy Uni stuff is going on. Make sure to follow our Facebook page and all our social medias!

description: With the coronavirus lockdown in place, there’s little for the F1 drivers to do except train, compete online and work out their strategies for when real-world racing resumes. And Williams’ George Russell, for one, has already got a cunning plan to benefit from any rustiness in his rivals when the 2020 F1 season finally gets underway…
author: F1 Nation
title: ‘Rusty’ first few races ‘an opportunity’ for Williams, says Russell
body: Speaking from his home in England on Formula 1’s brand new F1 Nation podcast, Russell revealed that, aside from sim racing, building his own home gym, learning how to cut hair and doing the garden, he’s been training hard to get himself prepped for the first Grands Prix of the year – but conceded that however much he and his fellow drivers trained, the first few race weekends would still be “incredibly hard” physically. “[The lockdown] just gives myself the chance to nail my fitness even more,” said Russell, “but I think for all of us, it’s going to be incredibly hard. You can train as much as you want, but you obviously lose race fitness. 'Running around the garden or doing weights in the gym is not the same as driving at 200mph around Silverstone, and that g-force is going to hit us hard that first practice session when we get back. But like I said, I’m doing everything I can to be prepared for that moment.'

author: Richard Lee
title: Motorsport Club BBQ Party, the first major event we are hosting this year!
body: Come along to our club's BBQ party, it will be so much fun!

description: Netflix’s Formula 1: Drive To Survive series has beamed the sport of F1 into the homes of a whole new audience, with viewers watching enraptured as the show’s cameras delved deep into the inner sanctums of the paddock’s 10 teams.
author: Greg Stuart
title: The inside story on the making of Netflix’s Formula 1: Drive to Survive blockbuster
body: Following a successful return for the series in February of this year, we spoke to Box to Box Films’ Paul Martin, one of Drive To Survive's Executive Producers, to get a candid insight into the making of the show. Read on to find out what Lewis Hamilton was really like to work with, the darkest moment of the programme's production so far, and why meeting Guenther Steiner was key to making Formula 1: Drive To Survive a success...

description: Red Bull ace Max Verstappen has updated his fans on his situation during the coronavirus lockdown, with the eight-time Grand Prix winner indicating he's staying sharp as a tack for the moment Formula 1 racing returns.
title: Verstappen staying sharp and ‘ready to race whenever’ during coronavirus lockdown
body: On his social media channels, he said: “At the moment through the current situation I try to stay at home as much as possible of course and try to do my workouts at home. 'Of course we stay ready, we do sim work - on my simulator at home - and of course a lot of training as well to stay ready for whenever we're going to get started again.I hope you guys are staying healthy in the meantime and I hope to see you guys all very soon.'

description: While Mercedes’ Dual Axis Steering system (DAS) made the headlines in pre-season 2020 testing and has been confirmed as banned from 2021, it’s now clear that this was merely a development of a system introduced by Mercedes on last year’s car, one which Ferrari – as we can reveal – had responded to by mid-season with a system of their own.
author: Mark Hughes
title: TECH TUESDAY: How Ferrari were just one step behind Mercedes on DAS
body: The PAS (Power Assisted Steering) systems used by both teams last year employed a twin rack and pinion, enabling the toe angles of each front wheel to be controlled independent of the other. This was done to enhance the Ackermann angle in slow corners – and the motivation was almost purely aerodynamic.

description: Thanks to a year of stability within Formula 1's technical regulations, the 2020 season should be a closely-fought affair. While that might suggest leaving the rules alone would be better for F1's spectacle, 2021's overhaul addresses deeper-lying issues.
author: Jonathan Noble
title: Why Brawn believes F1 2021's risks are worth it
body: It's been said many times in Formula 1 that one of the best ways to close up the grid is to leave the rules alone. By doing that, the law of diminishing returns at the front limits the top team, while the pursuing pack are slowly able to chip away at any deficit they had.

description: Retiring from the first two rallies of the season is far from a perfect announcement of your World Championship ambitions. But with a podium finish in Portugal, Scotsman Colin McRae began to turn his fortunes around in remarkable fashion, incredibly only finishing once off the podium over the remainder of the season.
title: WRC+ FOCUS: SEASON REVIEW 1995
body: Come along for this incredible season, that saw less than five points divide McRae and team-mate Carlos Sainz in a dominant performance for the Subaru World Rally Team.
